abstract: The deal deepens an existing partnership in a lucrative category of online classified advertising.
snippet: The deal deepens an existing partnership in a lucrative category of online classified advertising.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE, May 9 — Microsoft said Wednesday that it would take a small equity stake in CareerBuilder, a popular job recruitment site operated by three big media companies. The deal deepens an existing partnership in a lucrative category of online classified advertising.

headline.main: Microsoft to Invest in CareerBuilder Web Site
headline.print_headline: Microsoft to Invest in CareerBuilder Web Site

abstract: Windows Mobile 6 is now available as a free download for owners of the T-Mobile Dash.
snippet: Windows Mobile 6 is now available as a free download for owners of the T-Mobile Dash.
lead_paragraph: You’ll never be able to buy a boxed version of Microsoft’s latest mobile operating system, but who needs boxes? Windows Mobile 6, a considerable upgrade to the company’s operating system for smartphones and P.D.A.’s, is now available as a free download for owners of the T-Mobile Dash. Versions will soon be released for other smartphones, old and new, from multiple carriers.

headline.main: Windows Upgrade for Smartphones Improves Search and E-Mail Features
headline.print_headline: Windows Upgrade for Smartphones Improves Search and E-Mail Features

abstract: Microsoft said Wednesday that it would take a small equity stake in CareerBuilder, a popular job recruitment site operated by Tribune, Gannett and McClatchy. The deal deepens an existing partnership in a lucrative category of online classified advertising.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said Wednesday that it would take a small equity stake in CareerBuilder, a popular job recruitment site operated by Tribune, Gannett and McClatchy. The deal deepens an existing partnership in a lucrative category of online classified advertising.

headline.main: Microsoft to Invest in CareerBuilder Web Site

abstract: The online marketing firm 24/7 Media on Wednesday disclosed that it has hired Lehman Brothers to help it assess “strategic alternatives,” adding credence to rampant speculation that the company is up for sale. The New York Post reported this week that both WPP Group, the London-based advertising and marketing group, and software gaint Microsoft were “leading contenders” to buy 24/7, which has a market capitalization of about $560 million.
lead_paragraph: The online marketing firm 24/7 Media on Wednesday disclosed that it has hired Lehman Brothers to help it assess “strategic alternatives,” adding credence to rampant speculation that the company is up for sale. The New York Post reported this week that both WPP Group, the London-based advertising and marketing group, and software gaint Microsoft were “leading contenders” to buy 24/7, which has a market capitalization of about $560 million.
